messages.title: Fighting for the East End
messages.content: I'll fight against Theresa May's hard Brexit to protect local jobs and our economy. I'll fight for a fairer, safer and stronger East End.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Fight for Londoners and continue to campaign against a hard Brexit to prevent thousands of local jobs being at risk.
Campaign for homes people can afford in the East End. Build better homes and stand up for tenants in private and social housing.
Stand up for the NHS; Labour will protect our NHS and tackle the crisis in social care.
Fight for fair funding for schools - Labour will fight for a fair approach to school funding so money isn't taken away from London schools that desperately need it.
Continue to work with the Mayor of London, Sadiq Khan, to tackle air pollution and continue to campaign for safer streets.

issues.brexitEurope: Fight against Theresa May's hard Brexit to protect local jobs and our economy.
issues.economy: Protect local jobs and our economy.
issues.environment: Continue to work with the Mayor of London to tackle air pollution.
issues.health: Protect our NHS and tackle the crisis in social care.

housing.content: Campaign for homes people can afford in the East End.

leaflet.personalStatement: I'm proud to have served as your Member of Parliament for Bethnal Green and Bow since 2010.

politicalExperience.role: Member of Parliament for Bethnal Green and Bow
politicalExperience.achievements: Campaigned to remain in the European Union, fought against triggering Article 50, secured funding for housing and schools, saved local NHS GP surgeries, helped secure trade deal between the UK and Bangladesh.

leaflet.additionalNotes: I would be honoured if you supported me on Thursday 8th June.
